frontPageDescription: The Sheep view project inspired us to roadtrip and map the Faroe Islands
intro: My son Oskar wanted a road trip for our holiday week this year. We were thinking to go to Norway, Jotunheimen, when we read about the Faroe Island petition and the Sheep View project. How cool! I booked the tickets the day after we read the article, and last week we set off to drive as many of the roads of the Faroe Islands as possible.
author: Peter Neubauer

keys.title: Famjin
keys.description: Famjin with all cameras visible for navigation

keys.title: Roofs
keys.description: The green roofs are real agricultural assets and regularly cut for getting more hay for the sheep, as the slopes are too steep for growing anything almost everywhere else.

keys.title: From a helicopter
keys.description: Helicopter ride with side action cams pointed out the side window.

keys.title: The Fugloy bird cliff
keys.description: The big Bird cliff near Hattarvik/Fugloy with both action cams and phone photos

keys.title: Ferry ride outside Svinoy
keys.description: Riding a ferry back to Klaksvik

keys.title: Puffins!
keys.description: Puffins nesting like hobbits in the ground on Mykines

keys.title: Mykines
